definition: sum or volume of business transactions/turnover
to hand over/to deliver/to pay (money)/to turn over/to make friends/to intersect (lines)/variant of 跤[jiao1]
easy/amiable/to change/to exchange/prefix corresponding to the English adjective suffix "-able" or "-ible"
surname Yi/abbr. for 易經|易经[Yi4 jing1], the Book of Changes
forehead/horizontal tablet or inscribed board/specified number or amount

sentences.english: On the other hand, the rapid growth of e-commerce transactions.
sentences.chinese: 另一方面，電子商務交易額快速增長。

sentences.english: They stay even in value terms and create lots of trading volume.
sentences.chinese: 這些資產按價值計算仍然持平，並創造了大量交易額。

sentences.english: Mergers-and-acquisitions volume is down just 3% this year.
sentences.chinese: 併購交易額今年只減少了3%。

sentences.english: JBL daily trading volume of online trading platform for hundreds of millions of dollars.
sentences.chinese: JBL在線交易平臺每天交易額達數億美元。

sentences.english: In 2007, it reached over $2 million in online transactions.
sentences.chinese: 2007年，其網上交易額超過了200萬美元。

definition: (computing) transcoding/to convert (from one encoding to another)
